ygData.subject: Re: Invisibility
ygData.msgSnippet: So true. Invis is likely to be the fist Divination school spell a new Enchant has. If one is discovering town has has mana to spare, either use it or any
ygData.messageBody:
So true.

Invis is likely to be the fist 'Divination' school spell a new Enchant has.
If one is discovering town has has mana to spare, either use it or any form
of Minor Ill (same school) to boost this field. It looks like to me Invis
does not 'early flick' as often once Divination is better. End length is
the same apparently

Ibnabeth / Karana


At 08:33 21/04/1999 -0500, you wrote:
>From: "Miller, Keith A." <keithm@...>
>
>When you first get invis, your skill in that spell school likely sucks.
>You need to max it to get invis to work reliably. I was able to have my
>high elf enchanter cruise through most of Neriak invis and survive.
>well, until that dark elf enchanter cast see invis on a guard :)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: DeGirolami, Franck [mailto:degirolami@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 4:52 PM
>To: Eqenchanters (E-mail)
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Invisibility
>
>
>From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
>
>I gave up a level 16 dark-elf necro because their invisibility spell (
>gather shadows ) was very unreliable. One sad evening, coming back from
>a
>very long quest that brought me to Kerra Island and South Karana, I got
>hacked multiple times in Riverdale losing about 4 bubs of xp because my
>invis wore off on me randomly. I got really pissed off that at level 16,
>I
>could not manage to cast a level 8 spell reliably and decided to start
>another character more appropriate for travelling since I was very much
>into
>research and quests.
>With my enchantress, I got invisibility at level 4 and used it some
>times.
>It always seemed to work great but I might be wrong. Yesterday, I found
>out
>that this invisibility spell is as bad as gather shadows as a %$#%^^%$
>griffin nuked me a few seconds after I cast invisibility. Since then,
>I've
>noticed the same kind on unreliability...but only since I made level
>8...I
>might be wrong.
>Anyway, I would like to know how's the enchanter's invisibility like at
>level 16 or 20 or more. CAN YOU COUNT ON IT?
>Thanks,
>Skara, the pissed-off dark-elf Necro from Fennin-Ro
>now known as Skara, the enchantress from Innoruuk
>
